title: Dictionaries
text: actdata makes available number known EPA dictionaries. dictionaries provide measured evaluation, potency, activity values associated terms. package contains data 26 different publicly available affect control theory dictionary datasets. Metadata datasets shown table . detail columns included table. Within R, meta information plus descriptions citations sources can accessed using dict_info(). Leaving argument blank print information data sets. Pass function data set key see metadata just data set. Dataset key: identifier unique particular study (e.g. nc1978; morocco2015). keys used within package’s functions access particular datasets. Country context: country (context, internet) data originally collected. Year: year data collection. cases approximate; always check original sources definitive information. Data types: column indicates types summary data available dictionary. older dictionaries (pre-2015) provide term EPA values mean values. recent datasets, standard deviation (sd) covariance (cov) information also available. research affect control theory tradition utilized just mean values, recent work (e.g., Rogers 2019) BayesACT (Schröder, Hoey, Rogers 2016), recent Bayesian extension theory, used variance information individual-level responses investigate topics like demographic patterning meaning effects meaning uncertainty. identity: Words describe actors. Typically nouns (e.g. academic, woman, youngster) behavior: Actions actors can perform. Typically verbs (e.g. wheedle, acclaim, work) modifier: Typically adjectives can applied identities (e.g. active, witty, young) setting: Places situations (e.g. airplane, alley, worship_service) Genders: indicates available gender subsets. Options male, female, average. “Average” indicates participants genders included, though way calculated differs slightly dictionary. dictionaries (e.g. 2015 US, Morocco, Egypt dictionaries) originally published average values raters genders. cases, average provided option. dictionaries originally published male female subsets. title: Dictionaries
text: Contexts restrict labels consider reasonable choices. instance, two people discussing next year’s budget business meeting, seem quite unlikely one label “priest”. business-related label, like “manager” “employee”, label applies across variety contexts, like “genius” “jerk”, seem realistic. EPA dictionaries usually contain 14-digit binary strings known “institution codes” contain information social contexts terms apply within. codes can used analysis software simulating interaction. Valid categories (see Heise’s 2007 book Expressive Order details): * male, female: genders terms can typically applied (identities ) * overt, surmised: Whether labeling behaviors requires interpretation insight part observer (behaviors ) * place, time: Type setting (settings ) * lay, business, law, politics, academe, medicine, religion, family, sexual: Social institutions terms may belong . Institutions, behaviors, settings . * monadic, group, corporal: term requires implicates others. Identities, behaviors, settings . * adjective, adverb: Part speech (modifiers) * emotion, trait, status, feature, emotion_spiral: Categories modifiers. package provides several ways demystify make use codes. See function documentation details. * epa_subset() function takes institutions argument allows user filter institution. * expand_instcodes() function converts institution code strings columns containing TRUE/FALSE/NA values. values indicate whether category applicable term , , whether term belongs category. Representing institutions way makes easier users work . * create_instcode() function takes component set logical values indicating category membership returns properly formatted institution code binary string. useful creating new institution codes.

title: Affect Control Theory Dictionaries and Equations
text: Affect control theory social psychological theory cultural meaning interaction. , words quantatively-defined meanings three dimensions sentiment: evaluation (good vs bad), potency (powerful vs weak), activity (active vs passive). what: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
text: Returns subset EPA summary individual data fulfills given parameters. Filtering can done term, data set, component (identity, behavior, modifier, setting), type data (summary individual), statistics (mean, standard deviation, covariance), institutions term belongs , gender raters.

title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
code: epa_subset(   expr = ".*",   exactmatch = FALSE,   dataset = "all",   component = "all",   datatype = "summary",   gender = "all",   stat = "all",   stat_na_exclude = TRUE,   instcodes = TRUE,   institutions = "all",   drop.na.instcodes = FALSE )

title: EPA dictionary search and subset — epa_subset
text: expr term, regular expression, list terms regexs search. list provided, entries treated separated "", terms matching one entries returned. Default matches terms. exactmatch Logical indicating whether function return exact matches expression provided. FALSE (default), terms containing expression returned. dataset key data set (list multiple) search . Default ". Call dict_info() see available data sets. component component dictionary use (identity, behavior, modifier, setting). Default "." datatype Whether retrieve summary individual data. Default summary. gender gender dictionary use (male, female, average). Default "." Ignored datatype individual. stat statistics include subset returned. Default , options mean, sd (standard deviation), cov (covariance), n (number raters). Terms contain values required statistic excluded results. Ignored datatype individual. stat_na_exclude Ignored stat specified datatype individual. logical indicating whether exclude entries NA values required statistics. Default TRUE. instcodes Logical. Whether include institution codes output. Default TRUE. institutions Character list. Institutions include (defaults ) drop.na.instcodes Logical. filtering institution, whether keep terms institution code.

Add logical columns indicating institution membership to dataset — expand_instcodes
text: data data frame add institution code columns . Must contain term component columns. na.sub indicates handle institution codes NA. Options : NA (default) leaving NA; TRUE counting term belonging institutions; FALSE counting term belonging institutions, "drop" dropping .

what: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: function allows users easily convert dictionary subsets created format necessary providing BayesACT. reformatted dataframes can provided bayesactR::add_actor() function bayesactR package (recommended) can saved provided directly BayesACT C interface.

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: data data frame tibble object reformat stat character desired summary statistic include. Options "mean", "sd", "cov".

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: reformatted data frame. Output data frames following columns, left right order: term column type "character" 3 columns containing given E, P, mean values (order) summary statistic type "mean": Three numeric placeholder column. used BayesACT calculations required BayesACT inputs compatibility Interact Java format. summary statistic type "sd": 3 numeric columns containing given E, P, standard deviation values. summary statistic type "cov": 9 numeric columns containing given covariance values. , order, EE, EP, EA, PE, PP, PA, AE, AP, AA. Note covariance matrix symmetric matrix duplicate columns. institution codes column. BayesACT use information, require .

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
text: Input data frames following requirements: must column labeled "term" coercible character. Duplicate entries allowed recommended column. must three columns titled "E", "P", "" coercible numeric. treated sentiment mean scores BayesACT. summary statistic type sd (standard deviation), must three columns titles "sd_E", "sd_P", "sd_A" coercible numeric. summary statistic type cov (covariance), must nine columns titles "cov_XX", XX two-letter permutations E, P, , coercible numeric institution codes column (titled "instcodes") provided, arbitrary one added (information required used BayesACT) columns dropped column name format requirements generally satisfied subsets epa_summary_statistics dataset created epa_subset().

title: Format a data frame for use in BayesACT or bayesactR — format_for_bayesact
code: if (FALSE) { data <- epa_subset(dataset = "egypt2015", component = "identity",     institutions = c("law", "business"), stat = "cov") data_bayesformat <- format_for_bayesact(data, stat = "cov") }
